common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Application UI and Functionality Bugs
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with the Pieces Desktop Application, including a white screen on launch, off-screen buttons during onboarding, and Copilot errors. Proposed solutions include reinstalling the app, resizing the window, and waiting for the next release with bug fixes and performance improvements.

related_issues.title: Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
related_issues.text:
Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.2.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After installing, I get a screen to personalize my experience, but there's no way to continue after that:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa336e7-b02d-4b6c-8bcc-899cd4dc9679)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation
**Key Points:**

* User (@killerog) reported an interface bug where the next button was positioned off-screen on smaller screens (like their Macbook Air 11 inch).
* The user was able to bypass the bug through tabbing and luck.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces does not adapt well to smaller screens, causing buttons and other elements to be placed off-screen.
* This prevents users with smaller screens from completing actions and onboarding on the platform.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Upcoming release will include window resizing functionality during onboarding to avoid the off-screen button issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was acknowledged as a duplicate of #470.
* User was encouraged to share their display size and resolution to aid in fixing the issue definitively.
* The solution is currently in development and will be available in the next release.

**Additional notes:**

* Users with similar screen size issues should stay tuned for the next Pieces release.

related_issues.title: White screen on Windows 11
related_issues.text:
White screen on Windows 11
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Installed it yesterday and it was fine until it's a permanently blank screen today when I launch the Pieces Desktop app.

I reinstalled the entire suite multiple times and it's still the same.

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/33184869/bfba2d65-0393-4ef6-b8f9-dc958201fe5d)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Key points raised:**

* White screen appears in Pieces Desktop Application.
* User @jiaweing experiences the issue and shares local folder information.
* Another user @ubranch reports the same problem.
* User @JeffreyMJohnson reports the same problem and provides screenshots.

**Problems identified:**

* White screen issue affecting multiple users.
* Potential UI state information loss.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* User @mack-at-pieces suggests re-installing the latest version (3.1.0) with performance improvements.
* User @mack-at-pieces offers live troubleshooting via a calendar link.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue persists for some users, including @ubranch.
* User @JeffreyMJohnson scheduled a troubleshooting session with @mack-at-pieces.

**Additional comments:**

* User @ubranch expresses dissatisfaction with the Flutter framework for Windows tools.

**Overall:**

The white screen issue seems to be affecting multiple users of the Pieces Desktop Application. While a new version with performance improvements has been released, some users still experience the problem. Troubleshooting is ongoing, and it's unclear if the issue has been fully resolved.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation 

**Issue:** The OS toolbar isn't launching correctly upon launching Pieces OS via the Visual Studio plugin.

**Key Points:**
* Multiple users experiencing the problem (including `Andrea3i`).
* Various launch methods attempted with no success.
* Sentry logs indicate a failure related to the OS Toolbar.

**Solutions:**

* Initial attempt: Hotfix (v3.0.1) for Visual Studio plugin to fix a UI thread hang (unsuccessful).
* Later attempt: Update Pieces OS to v10.1.15 to modify port selection (partially successful)

**Impact:**

* New issue emerged, Pieces OS now self-restarts periodically.

**Resolution (in progress)**:

* Schedule meeting with `Andrea3i` for further debugging and investigation using a custom utility.
* Identifying root cause of OS error from the utility, such as IPv6-related concerns, restrictions, etc.

**Current Status:**

* Issue partially addressed, further debugging required.

**Next Steps:**
      
* User scheduled for meeting with developer for comprehensive debugging.

   

***NOTE:**

The identified solution in progress was mentioned in a comment on December 4, 2024. It isn't clear from the excerpt whether the meeting has occurred or the root cause determined as the conversation ends there and further information isn't available.  To stay informed it's recommended you refer to the GitHub  issue or contact  individuals mentioned.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@hra42) encounters an error during onboarding process.
* The error is related to cloud services and appears to be a PERMISSION_DENIED issue.
* The user's local database was deleted, possibly contributing to the issue.

**Problems identified:**

* Onboarding process fails for existing user who has deleted their local database but not the `com.pieces.pfd` folder.
* This results in skipping the generation of onboarding snippets and conversations.
* Additionally, a PERMISSION_DENIED error occurs when accessing cloud services.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The support team recommends reviewing similar issues and helpful resources.
* The team investigates the user's case and identifies the permission error.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The cause of the problem is known, but a solution is not yet identified.
* The issue remains unresolved and under investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* The user deleted the `com.pieces.os` and `com.pieces.pfd` folders but not the `com.pieces.pfd` folder.
* The user's actions may have contributed to the issue.
